description: An operations event class is a representation of groupings of operations event definitions
comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration âˆ’ Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: isAssembledFrom
contents.description: The nested operations event class(s) makes up part of this operations event class as the whole

contents.name: includesPropertiesOf
contents.description: This operations event class(s) include properties of the operations event class

contents.name: hasPropertiesOf
contents.description: The operations event class property(s) of this operations event class

contents.name: hasRecordSpecificationOf
contents.description: The operations event class record specification(s) related to this operations event class

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information and description about the operations event class

contents.name: extension
contents.description: Defines constraints on the inclusion of the respective operations event class in a hierarchy
contents.comment: Defined value are - sealed: no entry can use this entry as its parent; - (No entry): no entry allows any entry to represent this entry as its parent /ancestor. NOTE 1 Extension can contain a set of entries of other operations event classes who represent this entry in their parent
